about.about_description:
Australia is a must do destination.
Australia will suit travellers that like great beaches, wide open spaces, activities, interesting people, cultural experiences and nightlife.

low_seasons.low_seasons_3: Mid January - February (Winter and short days)
low_seasons.low_seasons_2: Southern Winter   June - August (Cool, Wet, Windy)
low_seasons.low_seasons_1: Northern Summer November - April (Very Hot, Humid and Raining)

high_seasons.high_seasons_3: New Year Late December - Early January
high_seasons.high_seasons_2: Southern Summer December - February (includes School Holidays)
high_seasons.high_seasons_1: Northern Winter  June - August (Dry and mild and busy with Tourists)

best_time_to_go.text:
Suggested Best time to go is the shoulder season when the weather is warm and dry. This varies between the North of Australia and South of Australia.        
Northern Australia including Darwin, Cairns, Kimberley is best May, Jun, Sep, Oct 
Southern Australia - Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth is best Feb to May and Oct to Early Dec

Otherwise Australia has something to offer at anytime... there is still plenty to see and do and experience all times of year!

suggested_itineraries_1.itineraries_name: The East Coast of Australia (Backpackers Banter)

best_activities_10.activity_name: Connect with the indigenous culture of Australia

best_activities_9.activity_name: Relax on a secluded island off the coast of Queensland

best_activities_8.activity_name: Marvel at Melbourne’s food and wine

best_activities_7.activity_name: Be thrilled by Horizontal Falls in the Kimberley

best_activities_6.activity_name: Drive the spectacular Great Ocean Road

best_activities_5.activity_name: Experience the beauty of Kakadu National Park

best_activities_4.activity_name: Rail through the Rainforest of North Queensland

best_activities_3.activity_name: Experience the wonder of  the Great Barrier Reef

best_activities_2.activity_name: Visit sacred land and be inspired by Uluru

best_activities_1.activity_name: Walk to the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge

volunteer_extra_website_link_list.text: Or Visit any community or Neighbourhood house

free_activities_extra_website_link_list.text: Tourism Australia's 100 Free things to do
Nomads World 101 free or cheap things to do

sightseeing_extra_website_link_list.text: Viator's 25 things to do in Australia

budget_and_costs.cost_description: Australia utilises cash, credit cards and debit cards.  Tipping is not customary. Use the below information as a guide for an indicative budget. Prices can vary considerably dependent on where in Australia you wish to travel to and the season

budget_airlines.text: Budget airlines operate from Asia (Singapore, Bali, Malaysia, Japan), New Zealand and Hawaii

full_service_airlines.text: Qantas is the Major Full Service airline of Australia and operates services to/from Africa, Asia, Europe (via Asia), USA, South America and South Pacific. Other major full service airlines operating flights to/from Australia include Virgin Australia, Air New Zealand, Emirates, Singapore Airlines, Cathay Pacific,

travelling_options.options_description:
Flying
Full service, Regional and Budget airlines operate in Australia and cover major cities and regional centres.
To find a detailed list of airlines which fly within Australia click the image above

hotel_direct_website_list.text: TFE Hotels - Travelodge, Medina, Rendevous and more...

where_to_stay.description: With a great range of accommodation options Australia has it all.  Luxury hotels, motels, holiday houses, house sits, resorts and cheap backpackers. The below gives you ideas on where to find options. We recommend not to BOOK just yet, use this information to get ideas...

duty_free.text: Check the duty free allowances for Australia

passport_visa.text:
A valid passport with a minimum of 6 months validity from the date of return is required for foreign travellers to Australia. 
Australia does require visitors to obtain a Visa (an entry stamp) prior to arrival.
To determine if you require a visa you can complete a preliminary check here
Regardless of your nationality it is also advisable to contact the relevant Embassy or Consulate for the most up information

language.text:
English is the main language spoken in Australia.
As the country is multi-cultural other languages spoken (in the larger cities) include Mandarin, Italian, Arabic, Cantonese and Greek.
Slang words are common in Australia

electrical.text: The required plugs and sockets for Australia

telphone_and_internet.text:
"Mobile access in Australia is available in majority of areas, although can be unreliable in remote and regional locations. 
Public phones are available in remote locations (a phone card with Telstra - the main provider) is recommended.
Service providers are Telstra, Optus, Vodaphone
Telstra offer the best phone coverage, particularly in remote locations.

Internet is readily available via Wifi (McDonalds provide a Free service), Wifi is unreliable between remote and some regional locations."

health_and_vaccination.text:
"Routine vaccinations are required and recommended for Australia. Check the Vaccinations you may need. 
Dengue fever occurs in Australia. It is recommended to take precautions.

Check with your health practitioner/doctor at least eight weeks prior to travel to confirm you are fit to travel and what vaccinations and health requirements you may need.
It is also recommended to have a dental check up as Dentists are very expensive in Australia

For further information on 
Latest Travel Alerts
Travel fact Sheets
Department of Health - Travel Health Information"

security_and_safe.text:
Check the latest security advice for the country you will be visiting.
Travellers information for Australia, UK, US Citizens, these can be used as a guide for any travellers.

Travel Insurance is highly recommended for travel to Australia.  Ensure travel insurance is comprehensive and includes (without limitation), cover for medical expenses, loss of luggage, cruise and land content any airfare charges due to cancellation, disruption, loss of deposits or strikes.

about.about_description: Japan is quirky! This vibrant and diverse country will suit the traveller who likes the latest gizmos, history and traditional culture.There is plenty to enjoy with sights, culinary delights, interesting people, nature, shopping and nightlife.

best_time_to_go.text: Suggested Best time to go is Spring when the cherry blossoms are blooming, this is late March through to May (avoid late April, early May due to the National holiday).Alternatively October, November - when the weather is dry and there is a better chance of seeing Mount Fiji,  you will also see the incredible Autumn colours.Otherwise you can enjoy Japan at anytime... there is still plenty to see and do and experience all times of year!

high_seasons.high_seasons_1: Summer July - August also includes School Holidays
high_seasons.high_seasons_2: Golden Week End of April - Early May (National Holidays)
high_seasons.high_seasons_3: New Year Late December - Early January

low_seasons.low_seasons_2: Mid January - February (Winter and short days)
low_seasons.low_seasons_3: Typhoon season is generally August - September  (Raining, humid and storms)

best_activities_2.activity_name: Mount Fuji  - best time is Summer or Spring

best_activities_3.activity_name: Cherry Blossoms   - best time is April

best_activities_4.activity_name: Tokyo's Tsukiji (Fish) Market - very early morning

best_activities_10.activity_name: Experience a bullet train, the cuisine, see a Geisha, visit a castle and so much more

top_places.top_place_name: Plan a trip to Mt Fuji

sightseeing_extra_website_link_list.text: Lonely Planet's Top 10 things to do in Japan

organised_extended_tours_extra_website_l.text: All Japan Tours, JTB sunrise Tours

free_activities_extra_website_link_list.text: Free things to do in Tokyo

budget_and_costs.costs_description: Japanese still use Cash so have some on you when you travel. Credit Cards are accepted in most of the country. Tipping is not customary.Prices can vary considerably dependent on where in Japan you wish to travel to and the season

full_service_airlines.text: International Japanese airlines with flights to/from Japan

budget_airlines.text: Budget airlines who operate to/from Japan

cruise.text: There are several Cruise lines that visit Japan, click the image for details.Ferries operate between Japan and China, Korea and Russia

travelling_options.options_description: For full details of all airlines click the image above

Driving in Japan is an option but not advisable in the larger cities. Car hire, RV and Motorhome hire is available. Major rental companies include Toyota Rentacar, Nippon Rentacar.  For full details on driving click the image above
Limited cruise ship cruise Japan, Princess cruises operate cruises around Japan and Asia. Ferries also operate extensively throughout. Japan.

There is a comprehensive train network in Japan using high speed rail.A train pass is available to foreign travellers and is an economical way to see the country.Hyperdia offer timetable information in English.
Airport to central city transport is provided by train, buses, taxi's and private vehicle.It is possible to hire a Motorbike in Japan.Pushbike hire is also a good option to get around.
There are a number of walks within major cities and regional areas.The tourist bureau provides a number of excellent travel guides for independent travellers

where_to_stay.description: Japan has an amazing array of accommodation options from luxurious resorts, comfortable hotels, traditional Ryokans

security_and_safe.text: It is recommended to check the latest security advice for Japan. Travellers information for Australia, UK, US Citizens, these can be used as a guide for any travellers. Travel Insurance is highly recommended. Ensure travel insurance is comprehensive and includes (without limitation), cover for medical expenses, loss of luggage, cruise and land content any airfare charges due to cancellation, disruption, loss of deposits or strikes.

health_and_vaccination.text: Check the Vaccinations you may need for Japan. Trekking or hiking can be strenuous, check with your health practitioner/doctor at least eight weeks prior to travel to confirm you are fit to travel. It is also recommended to have a dental check up prior to your trip.

telphone_and_internet.text: Mobile Access in Japan is available in majority of areas. Mobile roaming is expensive, alternatively purchase a sim card on arrival. Internet is readily available via Wifi. Pocket Wifi's can be hired

electrical.text: The voltage in Japan is 100 Volt, which is different from North America (120V), Central Europe (230V) and most other regions of the world. Japanese electrical plugs have two, non-polarized pins, as shown above. They fit into North American outlets

language.text: The language spoken in Japan is Japanese

passport_visa.text: A valid passport with a minimum of 6 months validity from the date of return is required for all foreign travellers to Japan. A number of Asian and Indian Sub Continent countries do require visitors to obtain a Visa (an entry stamp). Regardless of your nationality it is also advisable to contact the relevant Embassy or Consulate for the most up to date information.

duty_free.text: In Japan, displaying your passport at any store that offers tax exemption will allow you to purchase goods without the 8% consumption tax.

local_time.text: Japan Standard Time (JST) is 9 hours ahead of Coordinated Universal Time
